list_definition.definition: a compartment in a cowshed etc
a small shop or a counter or table on which goods are displayed for sale

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He bought a newspaper at the bookstall on the station

list_definition.definition: (of a car etc or its engine) to stop suddenly through lack of power, braking too quickly etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The car stalled when I was halfway up the hill.

list_definition.definition: (of an aircraft) to lose speed while flying and so go out of control

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The plane stalled just after take-off and crashed on to the runway.

list_definition.mean_english: làm cho động cơ chết máy, ngừng chạy
list_definition.definition: to cause (a car etc, or aircraft) to do this

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Use the brake gently or you’ll stall the engine.

list_definition.mean_english: tình trạng chòng chành, sự chết máy
list_definition.definition: a dangerous loss of flying speed in an aircraft, causing it to drop

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The plane went into a stall.

list_definition.definition: to avoid making a definite decision in order to give oneself more time

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They appear to be stalling on making a decision.

list_ex_of_english: In this section a closer look will be accorded the existence and forms of cooperation of spouses who held stalls.
During the days of faeces collection, the straw bedding was removed from the stalls.
Proposed improvements in bank regulatory oversight, stalled before the crisis, were now rammed through.
Throughout 1923 and 1924 women pressed and the government stalled on reform.
Growth in the first few years was very steep, then stalled, but then rebound after the 2005 legislative changes.
The model stalled about the same time as research on multiple equilibria did.
The market traders rent stalls from the market manager, and usually occupy the same stalls on the same days.
The previously-mentioned use of the wood of their stalls as a substitute is adequate grounds for the second complaint.
